content:
Abnormal uterine bleeding: Causes, diagnosis and treatment

Abnormal uterine bleeding is a pathological condition that can be related to uterine fibroids, uterine polyps, endocrine disorders, endometrial hyperplasia, cervical tumors, infections, and diseases. hematology... The disease causes symptoms of vaginal bleeding, occurring naturally, whether or not related to the menstrual cycle, or after sexual intercourse.

What is abnormal uterine bleeding?
Abnormal uterine bleeding (the medical term is Abnormal Uterine Bleeding - AUB) is abnormal bleeding from the uterus, different from the characteristics of a normal menstrual cycle. (first)
Abnormal uterine bleeding is bleeding from the uterus that is abnormal, different from the normal menstrual cycle
This condition affects the health of about 1/3 of the population of women of reproductive age. Diagnosing the cause of this condition is quite difficult and complicated. Therefore, as soon as there are unusual symptoms, women should immediately go to a medical facility for timely treatment.
A menstrual cycle is counted from the first day of menstrual bleeding of one menstrual period until the first day of menstrual bleeding of the next menstrual period. Normally, the menstrual cycle lasts about 21 - 35 days, menstruation lasts about 3 - 8 days, the first days of menstruation are usually heavy, then gradually decrease and menstruation is complete. If the menstrual cycle is shorter than 21 days or lasts longer than 35 days, or changes without menstruation for 3 - 6 months (also known as amenorrhea), it must be considered abnormal.

Causes of cervical bleeding
Doctor II Nguyen Ba My Nhi, Director of the Center for Obstetrics and Gynecology, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, said that there are many causes of abnormal uterine bleeding, these causes are systematized. Systematization is contained in the abbreviations of the names of causes and groups of causes (PALM & COEIN) to help gynecologists easily search for the cause of the disease comprehensively for appropriate treatment. (2)
The PALM & COEIN cause classification system has been described by the International Federation of Obstetrics and Gynecology (FIGO) since 2011, including:
Uterine polyps; Uterine adenomyosis or endometrial adenoma into the uterine muscle; Fibroids; Uterine malignant tumors; Hemostatic coagulopathy; Ovulation disorders; Cervical endometriosis; Bleeding caused by other treatments; Pathology has not been clearly defined
Women can recognize the signs of the disease through initial accompanying symptoms such as menstrual disorders (prolonged, heavy periods, menstruation not on the expected date, bleeding after intercourse). ...), urinary disorders, pain in the lower abdomen...
If not treated promptly and properly, abnormal vaginal bleeding can affect pregnancy and reproductive function, and significantly affect a woman's quality of life.
Pain in the lower abdomen, menstrual disorders... are common symptoms of gynecological diseases that cause abnormal uterine bleeding.

Signs of abnormal uterine bleeding
Timings and some forms of abnormal uterine bleeding (3)
Bleeding between menstrual cycles, or not related to the menstrual cycle.; Bleeding during puberty or around menopause, after menopause; Bleeding after sexual intercourse; Light spotting at any time during menstruation; Heavy bleeding (hypermenorrhea), bleeding that lasts longer than 8 days compared to normal (menorrhagia).; Bleeding after 6 - 12 weeks after giving birth, after cesarean section, after abortion...; Bleeding after using certain drugs, usually hormonal drugs; …

Diagnose the cause of abnormal bleeding
First, the doctor will inquire about your health and that of your family, as well as explore in-depth issues about your menstrual cycle. Therefore, you should write down details about your menstrual cycle before seeing your doctor, such as the date your period starts, how long each cycle lasts, the amount of your period (light, normal, heavy or dribbling...) , whether there are symptoms of severe abdominal pain or not...
Doctor II Nguyen Ba My Nhi is performing surgery at the Center for Obstetrics and Gynecology at Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City.
Next, the doctor conducts a general gynecological examination, and may prescribe some additional necessary tests and laboratory tests:
Blood tests to rule out pregnancy, evaluate whether anemia is present and the degree of anemia; Is there any endocrine disorder? Is there a blood clotting disorder, liver or kidney dysfunction...; Pelvic ultrasound, ultrasound pumping fluid into the uterine cavity.; MRI or CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis; Hysteroscopy.; Endometrial aspiration biopsy; …

Is abnormal uterine bleeding dangerous?
Abnormal uterine bleeding not only affects the patient's health, but also negatively impacts the patient's psychology.
If not treated promptly, women are at risk of facing many dangerous complications such as: Chronic and severe anemia leading to heart failure, physical weakness, and loss of ability to concentrate on work. , infertility, miscarriage, continued miscarriage, premature birth, fetal death in the uterus... or missing malignant diseases that progress through distant and severe stages.

Treatment of abnormal uterine bleeding
Doctor, CKII Nguyen Ba My Nhi said that determining the treatment method will depend on the cause of abnormal uterine bleeding and a number of other factors such as age, number of children and desire to have children. patient. Depending on the cause, treatments can be medical (medication treatment) or surgical (surgical intervention). (4)
Depending on the cause of abnormal uterine bleeding, your doctor will prescribe appropriate and effective treatment

How to prevent abnormal uterine bleeding?
Below are some measures to help prevent abnormal uterine bleeding that women need to know:
Do not arbitrarily or abuse taking hormonal drugs without consulting a gynecologist.; Clean daily, always keep the private area clean and dry.; Supplement all necessary nutrients, iron... as prescribed by your doctor and through your daily diet.; Visit a doctor immediately when you notice unusual signs to accurately determine the cause and have a timely and effective treatment plan.; Follow your doctor's instructions and recommendations during treatment for quick recovery.
In the context of the resurgence of the Covid-19 epidemic with changes in many strains of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, many pregnant women have to delay prenatal check-ups, losing the golden time to detect abnormalities during pregnancy. Understanding those difficulties, BS.CK II Nguyen Ba My Nhi, Director of the Obstetrics and Gynecology Center, along with skilled and experienced obstetrics and gynecology experts at Tam Anh General Hospital participated in answering questions of women through the program "ONLINE OBSTETRIC AND GYNECOLOGICAL CLINIC" every Tuesday, Friday and Saturday afternoon. Customers can view details of the program "ONLINE OBSTETRIC AND GYNECOLOGY CLINIC" and register for a free "online examination" with experts here. Abnormal uterine bleeding can seriously affect quality of life, as well as lead to many dangerous complications that affect a woman's reproductive function, ability to get pregnant, and motherhood. Therefore, as soon as you detect signs of abnormal vaginal bleeding, women should immediately go to a medical facility for early examination and timely and effective treatment intervention!
